name: getSourceAccountV3
description: Get details about given source account.

$ul: **autoTopUpConfig**
**enabled**: Is auto top-up enabled? automatically trigger funding to top-up the source account balance when the balance falls below the configured minimum level.
**fundingAccountId**: Id of funding account from which to pull funds when auto top-up is triggered.  Note - if this is not set then auto top-up is effectively disabled.
**minBalance**: When the payor balance falls below this level then auto top-up will be triggered. Note - This is in minor units.
**targetBalance**: When the payor balance falls below the min balance then auto top-up will request funds bring the balance to this level. Note - this is in minor units.
**balance**: Decimal implied
**country**: Valid ISO 3166 2 character country code. See the ISO specification for details.
**currency**: Valid ISO 4217 3 letter currency code. See the ISO specification for details.
**customerId**
**deleted**: An optional flag for whether the source account has been deleted. Only present in the response if true.
**deletedAt**: An optional timestamp when the source account has been deleted. Only present in the response if deleted.
**fundingRef**: The funding reference (will not be set for DECOUPLED accounts).
**id**: Source Account Id
**name**
**notifications**
**minimumBalance**
**payorId**
**physicalAccountId**: The physical account id (will not be set for DECOUPLED accounts).
**physicalAccountName**: The physical account name (will not be set for DECOUPLED accounts).
**pooled**: The pooled account flag (will not be set for DECOUPLED accounts).
**railsId**
**type**
**userDeleted**: An optional flag for whether the source account has been deleted by a user. Only present in the response if true.
**correlationId**: a unique identifier to track a request or related sequence of requests
**errors**: one or more errors
